alert.note: Alert for Alger; Delta; Dickinson; Marquette; Menominee; Northern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 9:41PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Dickinson, northwestern Delta, northeastern Menominee, southeastern Marquette, northwestern Schoolcraft and Alger Counties through 1015 PM EDT/915 PM CDT/... At 941 PM EDT/841 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Grand Island to near Trenary to near Foster City. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Chatham and Trenary around 945 PM EDT. Grand Island around 950 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Watson, Munising, Shingleton and Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT/1100 PM CDT/ for north central Upper and south central Upper Michigan.

area.areaDesc: Alger; Delta; Dickinson; Marquette; Menominee; Northern Schoolcraft
